import numpy as np 
import pandas as pd 
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
source.c902f508:
Vax_data ['Total Pop'] = (Vax_data.Series_Complete_Yes / (Vax_data.Series_Complete_Pop_Pct / 100 )).round()
Vax_data ['12+ Pop'] = (Vax_data.Series_Complete_12Plus / (Vax_data.Series_Complete_12PlusPop_Pct / 100 )).round()
Vax_data ['18+ Pop'] = (Vax_data.Series_Complete_18Plus / (Vax_data.Series_Complete_18PlusPop_Pct / 100 )).round()
Vax_data ['65+ Pop'] = (Vax_data.Series_Complete_65Plus/ (Vax_data.Series_Complete_65PlusPop_Pct / 100 )).round()
Vax_data ['12+ Pop'] = Vax_data['12+ Pop'].fillna(0)
Vax_data ['18+ Pop'] = Vax_data['18+ Pop'].fillna(0)
Vax_data ['65+ Pop'] = Vax_data['65+ Pop'].fillna(0)
Vax_data ['Total Pop'] = Vax_data['Total Pop'].fillna(0)
source.f6186740:
Q4_2020 = Vax_data[Vax_data.Date == "2020-12-31"].copy()
Q1_2021 = Vax_data[Vax_data.Date == "2021-03-31"].copy()
Q2_2021 = Vax_data[Vax_data.Date == "2021-06-30"].copy()
Q3_2021= Vax_data[Vax_data.Date == "2021-09-30"].copy()
N_2021= Vax_data[Vax_data.Date == "2021-11-06"].copy()
source.7f5bd226:
Q2_2021["Series_Complete_12PlusPop_Pct"].plot(kind ="hist", bins = 5)
plt.xlabel('Percent Bucket')
plt.xlabel('Number of Counties')
plt.title('Vax Percent of 12+ by Q2 2021 by County');

source.2ce1b3c1: Analyzing Data Types   ... need to change type of date from object
source.f153bebb: I wanted to create column that had total population per county. Sadly, this is the point I realized this data set was imcomplete. I think it would have been interesting to compare percentage vacinated on a total level in the US vs. the average vax rate per county. I was hoping to use this to back into population. Sadly, since there are so many 0s in the data set when I divided by 0 I got a null. I decided to fix the data and keep it in the case I could think of something nifty to do with it later.
